characters: THIS IS THE KAUAI COUNTY POLICE...
SHOW US HANDS...NOW WE WANT YOU ON
RIGHT AT THE END OF THE SENTENCE
WEAPONS DOWN, PUT YOUR WEAPONS DOWN
WE WANT TO SEE YOUR HANDS...HANDS,
THE CRAZY-ASS LOVE OF MY CRAZY-ASS

dialogues.speaker: BRIDESMAID
dialogues.text: ...it was all me. I was there at the Black Eyed Peas concert...I made the intros...I got them hooked up...I told Cliff he couldn’t play games with an Alpha Phi girl when he was seeing that other little slut. And then when he was going to propose? Finally? He practiced on me to get it right.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDESMAID
dialogues.text: So you gonna fuck him tonight, Rita? Scandalous laughter.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDESMAID
dialogues.text: (recovering with a joke) I already did. More laughter -- until “Rita” spots OUR CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDESMAID
dialogues.text: You gimme that thing. Right. Now.

dialogues.speaker: A1
dialogues.text: A scrum of his friends, film freaks, all hoisting Handyca and Coronas.

dialogues.speaker: GROOMSMAN
dialogues.text: (unaware of CAMERA) “Puppet show?” She did a puppet show after I left?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! What’s the good word for Cliff and Cydney? The guys orient to CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: A1
dialogues.text: Page 2.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: First the big studio sale, now the big wedding. M.V.P. year for our boy Clifford....

dialogues.speaker: GROOMSMAN
dialogues.text: I fuckin’ hate you, Anderson!

dialogues.speaker: GROOMSMAN
dialogues.text: When you’re all famous, don’t forget your posse from film class. Boys in the ‘Wood Hood.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: You dance with who brung ya, Cliff, you dance with who brung ya....

dialogues.speaker: GROOMSMAN
dialogues.text: (still not to CAMERA) It’s bullshit, right? Puppets just can’t pop out of a body like that. You guys’re just makin’ shit up ‘cuz I split the party early....

dialogues.speaker: B1
dialogues.text: Bouquet toss. The girls leap and scramble.

dialogues.speaker: C1
dialogues.text: Garter toss. The guys bob and weave.

dialogues.speaker: D1
dialogues.text: The BAND PLAYS Gary Hoey’s “Money.” Background, we see th bride, CYDNEY, wearing pinned-on greenbacks. Foreground, CHEAP MAN has his buck all ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: CHEAP MAN
dialogues.text: It’s called “a dollar dance.” CHEAP MAN’S WIFE In 1967, it was a “dollar dance.” Try a fifty. As they wrangle over denominations, Cydney changes dance partners in the background. A BEAR OF A MAN wraps her up.

dialogues.speaker: E1
dialogues.text: The CROWD ROARS approval: Cydney just pushed cake into he husband’s face. Sputtering, CLIFF takes off his glasses a looks around. All we see are two eyes and a mouth.

dialogues.speaker: E1
dialogues.text: Page 3. Facial!

dialogues.speaker: CROWD VOICE
dialogues.text: Cliff! You look like a white bowling ball, dude!

dialogues.speaker: F1
dialogues.text: Gift table. Unsupervised, the RING BOY and FLOWER GIRL te open wedding gifts. Christmas came early.

dialogues.speaker: G1
dialogues.text: The PARENTS OF THE GROOM. Father is retired Navy. trying to determine the exit-strategy. He’s

dialogues.speaker: FATHER OF GROOM
dialogues.text: Now I am still transporting Cliff and Cydney to the airport, correct? First thing in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER OF GROOM
dialogues.text: That changed. We’re picking them up after the honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER OF GROOM
dialogues.text: Just put it on paper, that’s all I ask. If Cliff can write a 120-page story for them, maybe he can write a one-page movement-order for his father. Where is that boy, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: H1
dialogues.text: The bar. Cliff is put in a headlock by an aggressively dr TOMMY. It’s an old sibling ritual that Cliff keeps hoping will die a natural death. It hasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: My little brother gettin’ married before me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wonder why. Barkeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C’mon, let up.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: ‘Nother brewsky here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Tommy, your armpit smells like ass, okay? Will you let the fuck up? Christ, 28 years old and he’s still doin’ it to me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 4.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Came all the way from Michigan to do this one more time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy savagely knuckle-rubs the top of Cliff’s head.

dialogues.speaker: J1
dialogues.text: Pool deck. CYDNEY’S SISTER tries to hide her cigarette wh being interviewed on CAMERA. She’s with a CLUELESS HUSBAN who pages through a guide book of Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CYDNEY’S SISTER ...well, far be it from my little sister to do the typical honeymoon -a high-rise in Waikik snorkel-pond? Don’t think so. Some friends of ours did The Kalalau Trail last year and came back with the most amazing pictures, so -CLUELESS HUSBAND So they’re going to Maui, right? 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister rolls her eyes. CAM PUSHES IN on a fold-out map of the Hawaiian islands as Husband gets corrected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CYDNEY’S SISTER “Kauai.” The last island, number five, one-two-three-four-five, right there. And hon, if you don’t know what you’re sayin’, please don’t say it on camera, ‘kay? (back to CAMERA) I think they just wanted to start off their lives together with some kind of...adventure....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. “W” HOTEL - WESTWOOD - NIGHT 2 VIDEO: Cliff and Cydney dash for the limo. He’s a winning combination of looks and smarts. She’s Alpha Phi, all ros and honey. Details beyond that are lost in a blizzard of rice, confetti, camera flashes. With his own Handycam, Cl tapes the WELL-WISHERS all around them. 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDEO: We’re SHOOTING Cliff from the POV of his own lap. He laps a shaved ice as he drives some kind of convertibl palm trees gliding through FRAME, everything set against achingly blue sky. 3  Page 5.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I have a question for you, Mr. Cliff Anderson of Venice Beach, California....

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yes, Mrs. Cydney Anderson, formally Miss Cydney Carswell of Pacific Palisades, California....

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How’d you get the little scar? Her finger enters FRAME, touching under his chin. CYDNEY (O.S./CONT’D) Can’t believe I just found it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Long story. Involves Homeland Security and me being unexpectedly pressed into service as a deputy air marshal. I don’t talk about it much. Try again.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Less grandiose.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Brother hit me with his skateboard when I was nine years old. Claims it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Which brother’s this?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: That’d be Tommy. Michigan. The one from

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Thought he said “Maryland” at the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Excuse me, whose brother is this?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, I saw like 16 brothers there. Okay, “Tommy from Michigan.” A new wife should know these things....

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Page 6.

dialogues.speaker: A3
dialogues.text: FLY CAM SHOT: Our first FILM VIEW reveals Cydney with her head in Cliff’s lap, Handycam rolling, her feet out the passenger window of a yellow Jeep. They drive through the endless lushness of Kauai.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: “Mrs. Cydney Anderson...Mrs. Cydney Carswell Anderson....” It’s like writing checks in January -- I know I’m going to blow it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Keep practicing.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Practice on this....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steals his shaved ice, gives it a suggestively long l

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Didn’t that guidebook say there were no snakes in Hawaii? 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 Outside, we see a WHAPPING helo on the pad, head-dipped tourists boarding. Inside, we FIND Cliff at the counter, paying cash for an upcoming tour.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: Now what about the extra video? Camera’s right there in front of you, getting all your reactions. We cut it into scenery from the tour.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (patting Handycam) Think I’ll take my own, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: Have it ready before you leave.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Just the one-hour “Fly Over To Die Over,” please. And might’nt you’ve come up with a better name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unwatched TV drones nearby, volume low.

dialogues.speaker: TV ANCHOR
dialogues.text: ...from all over the world, some to get married, some on their honeymoon, (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 7.

dialogues.speaker: TV ANCHOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: others to simply enjoy the trade winds and liquid sunshine. But for at least two young people, it seems paradise became a very dangerous place. Reporting from Honolulu is our own Katie Nakamura.... That HELO REVS UP outside. Cliff joins Cydney at the wind to watch the take-off -- but CAMERA STAYS BEHIND on that where the scene changes to a field reporter at a major cr scene. The HELO drowns out her words, but the ticker at t bottom of the screen reads... “Grisly Discovery At Honolulu Harbor.” 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 OUR AIRBORNE POV sweeps up and over a mountain ridge to reveal the great Wai’ale’ale Crater. Our stomachs drop ou beneath us. What a rush. 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6 We find Cliff and Cydney inside the sight-seeing chopper Cliff hangs out the starboard side to get it all on tape. Cydney hangs onto him, not trusting the harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Get back in here!

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Never knew there were so many shades of green! Here, get a picture of me! Everywhere, waterfalls drop 3,000 feet. Earth’s rivers end right here. 7 It’s like all the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight-seeing chopper overflys the Waimea Canyon, the “Grand Canyon of the Pacific,” all wild and raw... Exotic Manawaiopuna Falls, familiar from “Jurassic Park”. A pod of whales breaching coastal waters... And the great Napali Coast. Steep green mountains, carved by a million years of erosion, end abruptly at the Pacifi Ocean. A hiking trail is seen twisting and turning with t coastline. 7  Page 8. 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 From that trail below, TINY TREKKERS wave to us.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to pilot) I’m gonna do that! Kalalau! trail right down there! That

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Did it myself, back-in-the-day! Show you what it’s all for.... They THUNDER on toward... Kalalau Beach, a golden crescent of sand. Mountains cordo it off from inland areas -- and the rest of civilization.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Most gorgeous dead-end God ever made!

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Forget the hike! Just drop us off right now!

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Only two ways in and out, Cydney -on foot or by kayak. Bu makes it special! The pilot banks away. Cydney and Cliff crane necks to kee the beach in view as long as possible. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 FLY CAM SHOT: In a valley floor quilted with taro fields, Cliff and Cydney drive over a one-lane bridge and head fo the sleepy town of Hanalei. 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 The yellow Jeep parks. One tire stops right on a discarde newspaper, the “Oahu Daily News.” 11

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY GUY
dialogues.text: Now how many days you allow? A native SUPPLY GUY huddles with Cliff over a trail map. Nearby, his greying EARTH MOMMA wife rings purchases -deh mess kits, magnesium fire-starter, white gas stove. 11  Page 9.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: One day in, one on the beach, another day out?

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY GUY
dialogues.text: Common mistake.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You think I need more?

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY GUY
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you’ll need more, but you’ll sure want more. But so long as you got your permits and they’re generally up-to-date....

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, right here.... He keeps them inside a color brochure.

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY GUY
dialogues.text: (checking permits) Because the rangers do get out and work the trail, especially after the three-mile marker. So you want to keep these close, Cliff. Frowning, Cliff pulls a can off a shelf. It’s some kind o cut-rate Spam. If such a thing is possible.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: People will actually eat this? “Potted Meat Product?”

dialogues.speaker: EARTH MOMMA
dialogues.text: Honey, I won’t even read the ingredients. Comes to $427.57. Cydney appears with a few more things -- hats, sunblock, bandana -- adds them to the check-out pile.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: And these. (snuggling up to Cliff) Miss me?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (scowling at map) Three days sounds plenty to me.... Through an unwashed window, we see a primer-grey El Camin park outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 10.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Nine whole minutes -- that’s the longest we’ve been away from each other since we got married. You musta missed me something awful, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to Supply Guy) 11.5 miles, right? Each way?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (in Cliff’s ear) C’mon, just say you did. I’ll give you a b.j. in the car...another one....

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY GUY
dialogues.text: But see, you’re gonna cross five valleys, and each time you do, you’re gonna gain or lose 1,000 feet of elevation. That’s the killer. CLOSE on a mechanical parrot mounted above the entrance d the Hawaiian equivalent of a dingle-bell. It SQUAWKS as someone enters.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (mock huffy) Well, I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (teasing her) What, did you go somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: EARTH MOMMA
dialogues.text: Make that $475.35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff produces a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Know it looks like I robbed a bank, but....

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Our wedding haul. Now reveal CHRONIC, the owner of the El Camino. He’s a blonde-dreaded Rasta-punk with a beaded “CHRONIC” choker around his neck. (NOTE: Chronic and Earth Momma slip into local pidgin-spe It happens background.)

dialogues.speaker: EARTH MOMMA
dialogues.text: Howzit, baby boy.... (kissing him) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 11.

dialogues.speaker: EARTH MOMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Glad see back. Nowhere near Honolulu, were you?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: (shaking head) Other side. Waves was junk for three days, mo bettah here. Why, what’s the stink in ‘Lulu?

dialogues.speaker: EARTH MOMMA
dialogues.text: (remembering customers) Maybe nuff for now. Wanna help these two out to their car?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Shoots, yeah. Just dump my gear, be ri’ widdem. Chronic flashes Cliff and Cydney a grin before heading fo the rear of the store. He seems like a harmless doper. Though he did get a look at Cliff’s wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to Earth Momma) I think we got it. Thanks. 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 Finished loading, Cliff and Cydney hop back into the Jeep As they CRANK OVER, the Supply Guy and his wife step outs to see them off.

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY GUY
dialogues.text: And get an early start! Aloha!

dialogues.speaker: EARTH MOMMA
dialogues.text: A friendly round of waves. But as Cliff backs up... One tire uncovers that Oahu newspaper -- the one they nev saw. A photo shows two bodies covered in bloody sheets. The headline reveals “Young Couple Butchered in Honolulu. 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 13 First light bathes the island gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLY CAM SHOT: We’re bombing along Highway 560 in our yell Jeep, en route to the trailhead. 93.5 (“KONG”) plays some bouncy reggae, “I Need Your Love.” 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 12.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (singing along) Won’t you open up your heart... And let me in... For you and I will never part... That you should know, so... I need your love for more than just an hour... I need your love more than just a day... So hold me close, my love will never falter... I need your love each and every day... Na-na-na-na-na-na.... Cliff joins in on the NA-NA-NA chorus.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: I love our new lives. The Jeep wheels onward, soon rounding a bend and passing. Two hitchers, backs turned, thumbs out. Cliff pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: What’re you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: It’s Hawaii. It’s a two-word defense unto itself. Cydney scowls at her side mirror. There we see the two hitchers hustling close Male and female, late 20s.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: So in Hawaii, Cliff and Cydney do things they normally wouldn’t? Like pick up hitch-hikers?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Nothing bad ever happens here, right? HIS REARVIEW MIRROR POV: Of the hitchers. The closer get, the dodgier they get: The girl looks like Oxnard skank, wearing an almost-nuthin’ bandana top. The guy dark and ripped, the kind of rip you get from steroids prison. Or steroids in prison.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: That’s a hard look they got.... they surfer is or  Page 13. KALE (him) and CLEO (her) sling their rucksacks aboard.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: How far you goin’?

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Lumahai beach? That area?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (buying time) Lumahai...Lumahai...not sure we know that....

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: ‘Bout 10 miles ahead, right on this road. You know, right by where the big trail starts. You know that trail?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, sure. That big trail.... Cliff spots a tattoo on Kale’s chest. It’s right where an E.R. doctor might want to put his defib paddle. And it sa “DO NOT REVIVE.” CLIFF (CONT’D) ...but we aren’t goin’ that far. Cydney looks relieved. But Kale looks unhappy about getti out of a ride he’s already in. Especially when that ride full of trail gear.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: So how far do you go?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Just, y’know. Up the road here. (off Kale’s stare) So if you just hang here another five minutes, maybe someone else comes along who can take you all the -CLEO We was waitin’ for, like, an hour ‘fore you stopped. Maybe more. Shit, thought this was Hawaii. Kale jumps out, grabs his rucksack. C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: With a desperate edge, Cleo produces photos and starts showing them to Cydney.  Page 14.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Some of these pitchers totally suck -just one of those ca afterwards. But this one, this one’s good....

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: These people wanna see less of us, Cleo. Not more.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: That’s Kale gettin’ a new tatt.... Uh-huh....

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Oh, here, here it is. That’s us doin’ the deed on Oahu -- just woke up one morning and decided to get married. Pretty, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (coming around) Oh, yeah. It is pretty with that whole arbor of.... (a double-take) Is this a grocery store?

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: “Paula’s Market.” They do it up real nice for you -- put that big hoop thing over your head with all kinds of lettuces and pineapple parts and stuff. Produce manager took that pitcher. I know it sounds kinda tacky? But it was pretty friggin’ pretty after they added all the little radishes in there.... Cydney shows the photo to Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Kale and Cleo getting married on Oahu.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (nodding “nice”) Suitable for framing. He taps his wedding ring on the steering wheel, deliberat a beat before...  Page 15.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Tell you what. We’ll just drive you there.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Only 10 miles, right? there by now. Coulda been

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: Maybe next time. Aw, Kale.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Don’t be that way.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: Get out, baby.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: C’mon, guys. Let’s not turn this into a bigger deal than it really -KALE Cleo. Get the fuck out of this man’s ride. Cleo knows that tone of voice -- and knows to respect it. Kale rounds the car for a private word with Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: My mother, she was like this... metaphysical gypsy Christian psychic chick. Know the type, right? Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: I used to think she was messed up in the head, but then sometimes... something occurs...that makes me think I acquired some of her gypsy powers. Like right now. Right now I do believe I can divine what you’re thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: An’ what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: “I hope I never run into this dire motherfucker again.” It’s a pretty good guess. Kale raps on the Jeep like a ca salesman seeing you off the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 16.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: Take care, Hot Wheels. Cliff takes the cue and hits the gas. 15

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: So. Could we maybe have handled that better? Forget it. mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Already in my rearview Of Kale and Cleo. Growing small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 Two kinds of people here: Those who haven’t done the trai unpack cars energetically. Those who just finished the tr -- muddy to the knees -- load cars like the living dead. VIDEO POV: Smiles back in place, Cliff and Cydney pose ne a sign heralding the “Kalalau Trail.” Per norm, Cydney is draped all over Cliff. When the VIDEO IMAGE CLICKS OFF... We CUT BACK to our FILM VIEW. Handycam to Cliff. Look good? A CAMERA SAMARITAN returns the

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA SAMARITAN
dialogues.text: I was just pointing and shooting. Too many buttons on these new things.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Yeah -- that’s what you get for buyin’ top-of-the-line. Might have to actually break down and read the manual someday.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Let’s get it star-ted...let’s get it star-ted in here.... Cliff and Cydney shrug into their packs and hit the trail They pass another sign.

dialogues.speaker: FROM HERE TO KALALAU
dialogues.text: Page 17. 17 EXT. ABOVE KE’E BEACH - THE TRAIL - DAY 17 A half-hour later. Now baptized in sweat and mud, Cliff a Cydney reach an open spot on the trail and look back on.. The northern tip of the island. Sunlight rakes across Ke’ beach and its postcard-perfect reef lagoon. Beyond that l a sea of undulating glass.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: The perfect getaway. 18 EXT. CRAWLER’S LEDGE - THE TRAIL - DAY The terra-cotta trail narrows. To the right is one of tho “steep drop-offs.” Making things worse, a weepy waterfall drains across the trail ahead, and some of the rocks seem slippery with moss. (VFX SHOTS.)

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Well, everyone else did it.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Did they really? He leans right, checking for bodies that might be litteri the CRASHING SURF far below.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Show it no fear. Coming up from behind is NICK, 32. He wears nylon jeans, sport sandals, mil-spec Boonie hat, an engaging grin -- a wrapped up in an air of invincibility. Make that “a flair of invincibility.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (re trail) Is some of it washed out, or....

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Watch me. Keep your eyes down, your speed up...avoid the green rocks... and just...be...fearless. Just like that, he’s across the bad patch.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (to Cliff) Made it look easy.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: He’s not wearing an A-16 store on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 18. In fact, all Nick carries is a butane tank and walking st Now Cliff girds and goes. He’s not as slick as Nick, but makes it to the other side without calamity. Nick pulls h past and now motions for... Cydney. Starting across. Nick holds out his stick, offering it should she need it. Below Cydney, WAVES BOOM ONTO ROCKS.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Doin’ good, Cydney, doin’ real good.... Suddenly a TOURIST HELO ROCKETS overhead. Cydney startles. Her foot hits a green rock. Pushes off. Slips. Cydney totters on the edge, her hand grabbing blindly for Nick’s stick. Missing...missing... And snagging it. Nick pulls hard and straight. Suddenly Cydney is on the other side, the safe side, reeled into Nick’s arms. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But look, it all starts with story. Like the time I made a surprise visit to a certain dictator’s palace on the Tigris River. Newly evacuated -could still smell fine Hav hangin’ in the air. We were tasked with finding perishable intel, computer disks, shit like that. But in the master bathroom -- about the size of Ethiopia, by the way, big golden dolphins for faucets -- there was this lock-box bolted to the floor. Had initials engraved on top, his initials. We start beatin’ on the lock -CLIFF (orienting) Iraq. You were in Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: First in. Me and my wolf pack. Fuck those pictures you saw about the 4th Infantry -- that was later. What I’m givin’ you now is God’s Real Shit from an operator who had true eyes-on.

dialogues.text: (sing-songy) He’s not supposed to talk about this stuff.... She offers the joint to Cydney. No, no.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So inside this box, I figure maybe cash, maybe a set of pearl-handled pistolas, or hey, maybe some damn fine Presidential-grade hashish. We finally burn it open with 50-grain det-cord. Handy tool, det-cord -you can wrap it around a feet thick and -- PHHHHT! -- drop it across the trail when someone’s hot on your ass. Remember that trick.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: “Det cord.” Nice detail.  Page 36.

dialogues.text: Well, gotta get the details right. Otherwise, you’re just makin’ another big crap-tastic movie. So we open up that box and what do we find? Iron Man. Avengers. The dude was a Silver Age Marvel freak. And can you believe what he had most of? In his own personal stash?

dialogues.text: I wasn’t there, Nick.

dialogues.text: Sub-Mariner.

dialogues.text: Really. So why Sub-Mariner? that one of the shit titles? Isn’t
