dialogues.text: One theory? Tug-job material. Mr. Presidente had a thing for Frenchspeaking fellahs with li and big spears. One theory.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: So you’re Special Ops. Rangers, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seals,

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Officially...I’m only allowed to say that I’ve been a sworn officer participating in the tactical phase of certain missions that would make most men wanna crawl up and hide inside their own assholes.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: But unofficially....

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m a Goddamn American Jedi. Possible Title #1, by the way. See this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 37. He whips off his Boonie hat and bandana beneath. There’s wicked scar on the back of his head where someone seeming tried a back-door lobotomy. Oooh.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Put it back on.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Took frag from a Bounding Betty -anti-personnel mine. Cav my head. Medivacked out to Germany, got my skull rebuilt with space-age titanium. Can’t go through a metal detector without ringing cherries. But that’s cool, cuz, see...it lets me travel with Gilligan just about whenever I want.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: “Gilligan?” Nick hikes up his nylon pants. A 10-inch tactical knife, black, is strapped to one shin bone.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “My little buddy.” Cliff stops looking over his shoulder now -- and starts looking at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: That’s some toothpick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But here’s the kicker: When I took that shrapnel? I never felt it, Cliff. I mean, I felt impact, felt my backside go all wet -- but no real pain. Now maybe I don’t recall events in full -- they did scoop out a little Grey Spam back there -- but they tell me, get this, my wolf pack will swear that I was ambulatory for more than 17 minutes before they forced me to lie down. Tackled me. And even then, I was lookin’ to monkey-fuck a Marlboro Light. No nerve endings in the brain, Cliff. Remember that when you write the scene. Cliff touches eyes with Cydney. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Lotta good details there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 38.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (proud) He’s very hard to kill. 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 As those storm clouds march closer to shore. 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 Nick, Gina, Cliff, and Cydney reach a wide swath of water flowing across the trail. TWO TIRED TREKKERS appear on th opposite side. Nick and Gina ford across. Cliff drops his pack and start adjusting straps -- but it’s really an excuse to hang bac to get separation on... Nick and Gina. Meeting the trekkers halfway across.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Y’all make it to the beach?

dialogues.speaker: TIRED TREKKER
dialogues.text: Just keep goin’. It’s great. Nick and Gina slosh on. Soon the trekkers are across the spillway and with Cliff and Cydney.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (low) See any rangers up ahead?

dialogues.speaker: TIRED TREKKER
dialogues.text: None we saw.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: So just another three miles to the beach? We hope?

dialogues.speaker: TIRED TREKKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, but...a lot of twists and turns ahead. The trekkers keep going. Cliff checks on Nick and Gina. They’re just reaching the other side.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Further we go, fewer people on the trail.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: And your point is....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 39. He peeks at his cell phone. Some reception now.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (chin-nodding) Over there. Pretend you need to piss. “Pretend?”

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: She squats in bushes. Cliff calls up that web-page, the o with the “DOWNLOAD NOW” button. He keys it. Line by line picture appears.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Cops in Honolulu released a photo... ‘parently killers didn’t know they were on camera.... It’s a marginal photo to begin with -- black-and-white by night -- and the low-rez screen doesn’t help. But two figures are seen, male and female, dragging bodies down a rain-slicked wharf. Shit. What?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: He shows her. There’s a telling moment where we HEAR HER PISS-STREAM STOP prematurely.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Could be anybody.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You sure about that? familiar? They don’t look...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Y’ALL GOOD BACK THERE?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Bathroom break!

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: It could be anybody, Cliff. Now Cliff unzips, buying a little more time.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Well, how much we really know about these people? Aside from him and his stories -- which, I might add, are (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 40.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: starting to sound more and more bullshitty to me. Next we’re gonna hear he’s got the heart of a baboon, or something.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: I think he just wants to impress. He’s hoping you’ll want to write a movie about his -CLIFF What do we know?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (a sigh, then rat-a-tat) She’s from Savannah, father was an over-controlling military shit, she rebelled, met Nick in South Carolina but he reminded her too much of Daddy, he chased her until finally giving up and moving on, that’s when she got interested in him, of course, first time in Hawaii, thought Waikiki was a little Las Vegas but they love it here on Kauai. (off his look) Girls talk.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: So they were on Oahu, too.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: I guess they were. HOLD on their pensive faces a beat before we...

dialogues.speaker: A33
dialogues.text: Nick and Gina. Waiting on their side of the spillway. Watching Cliff and Cydney talking 30 yards back.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Interesting guy, Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: First man ever who wants to talk while he’s in the bathroom, though. What is goin’ on back there? Rain starts to fall. Trying to move things along:

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “YOU KEEP SHAKIN’ THAT BUSH SO WE KNOW YOU’RE THERE! JUST KEEP SHAKIN’ THAT BUSH, LUKE!”

dialogues.speaker: A33
dialogues.text: Page 41. Cliff waves at Nick from afar.

dialogues.speaker: B33
dialogues.text: Cliff and Cydney. She decides she’s not going to let her head go where Cliff’s went.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Look, we’re supposed to be on our honeymoon, okay? And this is one of the most beautiful places on Earth -rain or shine -- so w just slow down that overactive brain of yours. I want to enjoy myself here. She starts across the spillway toward Nick and Gina. lingers, fixated on that photo on his cell phone. Cliff

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Babe, we’re gonna be fine. 34

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIL
dialogues.text: 34 RAIN HAMMERS down. VARIOUS SHOTS of water cascading down the valleys, spouti over cliffs, sweeping across the trail. It’s like the opening salvo of some biblical flood. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just off-trail is a coastal bluff with a rare bit of flat land. A lean-to is already up, basic cover for Cydney and Gina as they unpack and try to keep things dry.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, guess the beach’ll still be there tomorrow.... The wind steals a bed-pad. Cydney goes after it.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Hope we are! Nearby, Cliff erects a small tent. He’s trying to stomp stakes into the ground. But soon he hears a PRECISION CLINGING and tracks the sound to... Nick. Putting up his own tent, he HAMMERS his stakes with steel trail axe. All finished, he flips the axe to... Cliff. Catching it. Right before it hit his head. 35  Page 42.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Good reflexes! For a writer! Cliff glares. He’s either getting really worried about th guy -- or righteously pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: A35
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of Cydney and Gina. Firing up white-gas stove Plunking purification tablets into water. Running up a lantern for more light. Rummaging through their dehydrate food pouches, playing “Who Has the Worse Shit For Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: “Macaroni and Cheese?” “Imitation Cheese?” With real

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Honey, that’s a vegetable dish where I come from. What else?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: We bought “Chicken A La King -- with Pre-Toasted Toast.”

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Gotcha beat. “Hungarian-Style Goulash with Beef-Shank Bits.”

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Okay, but is that really worse than, say, oh, “Vegetarian Corned Beef Hash?”

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Suspicious, isn’t it? But I might open that before I’d open...“Chicken Omelette Surprise.”

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with that? the surprise? And what’s

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: The “surprise” is that we’re gonna take the egg out of the chicken, whip it up, then put the chicken back in the egg. Who the hell eats chicken omelettes, anyway? Well, all I’m about (with “Potted.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: this pales compared to what to show you right now. a flourish) Meat. Product.”

dialogues.speaker: A35
dialogues.text: Page 43.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (scandalized) Oh, you didn’t. Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: He can be gross sometimes. Knowing it’s a winner, she hands the can to Gina and reac for a sip of water.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (reading label) “Partially Defatted Cooked Pork Fatty Tissue.” Dear Lord, what do we tell the children.... Cydney snarfs water out her nose. getting along just fine. 36 The girls, anyway, are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 100 feet removed, we see the campsite through a gauze of rain. Presently two boots slosh into foreground and stop. Another pair of boots joins. Someone’s watching our camp. 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 Zipping up a fresh wind-breaker, Cliff exits his tent and heads for the lean-to where... The girls are on their feet, alert, staring out at... Nick. He’s a statue in the rain, eyes riveted on some inl trees that wuther in the wind. What? What what?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean, “What what?” everyone lookin’ at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Whatever he’s lookin’ at. Tense and quiet, they all scan. It’s approaching twilight now, that time of day that can play tricks on your eyes. Is there something out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 44.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Probably just a goat. these valleys. Lot of ‘em in

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: I haven’t seen any goats. Relaxing, Nick ducks under the lean-to, opens a bottle of “Scorpion Mescal,” takes a slug. A scorpion floats inside blissful in death.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Don’t expect you would, Cliff -- your situational awareness kinda sucks. That’s not a knock -- you’re a screenwriter, I’m a Jedi. Just the different paths we chose. He passes Cliff the Scorpion Mescal. NICK (CONT’D) (re scorpion) Think they kill him first? Or he just drown in there? Always wonder.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Just so I know whether to be offended or not, define “situational awareness.” Nick starts assembling a bi-fold apparatus from his pack, opening it up, dogging it down, running carbon cables thr eccentric pulleys.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What’s the first thing you do when you step onto a plane? Maybe have a sip of that fine champagne up there. You do fly First Class, right?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: I put my shit away like everyone else. That’s what I do.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: When I board a plane -- makin’ my way back to the cheap seats -- I clock every door and pace off the distance between those exits and my seat. If the plane loses power on take-off, I can make egress in the dark, totally blind. If the aisle crowds up, I know I’m climbin’ over the back of 36D, the guy with the shiny toupee, to make that over-the-wing exit. I (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 45.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: know the handle swings down, not up, I know the door swings in, not out. And I know all this inside of 30 seconds, Cliff -- before they even pop the cork for you up there in Hollywood Class. His apparatus is taking shape as a compound hunting bow. Nick checks the string tension -- TWANG! -- and adjusts s more like a man tuning his guitar. NICK (CONT’D) See, if you wait until the emergency happens to figure out what you’re gonna do -- you’re already dead. An itchy silence: Taken one way, it was an engaging story that could work its way into a screenplay. Taken another, it’s a death sentence.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (trying to change subjects) Well, chances of that happening....

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Happened in Sioux City.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Sioux City?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: DC-10 rolled four times on landing, wound up in a Iowa cornfield. 112 dead.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (remembering) I saw it on TV. Awful.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And I saw it from the inside. A beat. “Are you tellin’ us....”

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (even prouder) He’s really hard to kill. Nick takes another pull of Scorpion Mescal, grabs the axe flips it to Cliff. Again. Lessgo.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Page 46.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What you goin’ after with that thing? Dinner.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Dry underwear. But thanks.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Here, kitty, kitty, kitty.... Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, no problem. You wanna stay in the kitchen with the lady-folk, you stay. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portrait of a man in his element: Nick is on the prowl, hunting bow at low guard, eyes on high alert. He PASSES CAMERA, and a beat later comes... Cliff, axe in hand. He can’t fathom how he came to be out here in the dark...in the rain...on his honeymoon. Soon h pauses, eyes searching. Behind him, the smeary glow of ou campsite is still visible. But where’d Nick go?

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You know, crossed my mind... He rolls out from behind a tree. NICK (CONT’D) ...that it crossed your mind...that we’re the ones. Me and Gina.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: “The ones” who....

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Cliff. I mean, that’s your screenplay-writer mind workin’ its magic, spinning stuff every which way. You gotta think like that.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (laughing it off) What, the killers? 38  Page 47.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “The Gruesome Twosome.” Title #2. Possible

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Sounds like your mind’s spinnin’, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So you think it’s just coincidence we were there at the same time. On Oahu.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (nodding) Just like me and Cydney we were there.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Lotta people on Oahu when the murders happened. That’s how you look at it, huh, Cliff?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Exactly how I look at it, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Good. (a scanning beat) Though would make a helluvan Act Two twist.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: We’re not really hunting goats, are we? No.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It hangs there a beat.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Then why don’t you just tell me what the hell we are -NICK (drawing close) We got us a shadow -- two of ‘em. Haven’t identified as hostile yet, but they passed our camp once... doubled back for a second look... then took cover in here. (off Cliff’s face) I know you didn’t see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 48.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: People at the falls?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: This is someone else. A spooky beat.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Should get back to camp, then.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Gina can take care of herself.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Thinking ‘bout Cydney.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Gina can take care of her, too.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (screwing up face) Are you just so fuckin’ with me, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: If I was the killer, wouldn’t stay on Oahu. I’d fall back to the most remote part of the most remote island. I’d come right here. With that, he vanishes into the forest. Cliff takes a mom to wipe his glasses dry. And think. And follow. 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring out into rainy twilight:

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Little worried about Cliff. He’s not really the bow-and-arrow type.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Boys are happiest when they’re huntin’ something they can’t quite catch. ‘Sides, gives us a little time together. She looks at Cydney unbrokenly as she sparks up a joint, takes an inviting pull.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Dope was never my thing. 39  Page 49.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: So what is your thing, Cydney? We haven’t really heard yet.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Probably sound boring to you. Try me.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Well, we’re working very hard at getting pregnant. We’ll have five kids, two boys and three girls, and they’ll be beautiful beyond belief, of course. We’ll live in the Palisades near one of the bluffs, take long summer walks and look out at the sailboats on the ocean, all of us, the whole big family. And I guess I’ll just be happy to be “Mom” and “Mrs. Cydney Anderson” for a good long while.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: “It’s Pillsbury fresh.” Cydney cocks her head. “What’s that supposed to mean?” GINA (CONT’D) Sorry. Some people get all dull when they smoke? Me myself, I get an edge. So why do I think there’s some wild-child in your past?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Why do you?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (indicating eyebrow) Hmm, maybe those liddle-iddy-biddy holes where the rings useta be. What, three or four of ‘em? (a beat) Had this preacher back in Georgia. Used to tell all the kids we’d rot in hell for havin’ sex outside the sanctity of marriage. Then bless his heart, one day his wife catches him out back of the Waffle House with some hooker -- some hooker with a really big dick. So now when I meet people who wanna tell me how so damn perfect their lives are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 50. She shrugs. “They usually ain’t.” Cydney rocks back and just eyes Gina, realizing she’s smarter than she lets on.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Well, it gets into things.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Worst we can do is rot in hell. And the rain keeps coming. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 Cliff threads his way through dank forest. The deeper he goes, the darker it gets. The deeper he goes, the more th axe-handle rolls in his hand. CLIFF’S POV: Of Nick leading the way. He throws a few hand-signals back at us that seem like the Chinese versio rock-scissor-paper. Cliff starts to close the gap. But he slows when he catch something out of the edge of one eye. CLIFF’S POV: A smear of lantern-light. Nick.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: But Nick prowls on, slipping out of view. veer off toward that light. Cliff decides to CLIFF’S POV: Under an umbrella of foliage, two rain-blurr silhouettes cross in front of a lantern. One man. One woman. Cliff draws closer, for a few seconds losing the stranger behind thicket. When his sight-line opens up again... CLIFF’S POV: We see that the woman is clearly not Cleo. This is someone new. And the man.... The man is missing. 41 Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re back with the girls. 41 Back in confessional.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: I lie about my old life sometimes. Because when my folks finally stopped knocking the crap out of each other and split up, they decided they could (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 51.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: handle two kids each. Thing was... there were five in the family. It takes a beat for Gina to realize what she means. “Wow.” CYDNEY (CONT’D) Some kids run away from their parents? Mine sorta ran away from me. Did the foster-scare thing, but that lasted just until I met this guy, “Rocky,” couple years older. Now most people thought Rocky was this fine young gentleman, but I saw something else -something risky. Som and cool.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Didn’t hurt that he had his own truck, neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Wrong paint on one door. But damn, he had some nice chrome wheels on it. He did.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Little locks on ‘em, too.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: And you could go wherever you wanted to in that shitty-ass truck, anywhere in the world. Sure, I know Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Drove me down to the lake one night. It was hot but raining, kind of like this. I had the top button of my shorts all undone for this guy, hoping this is why we came down here. I remember how the cracks in the vinyl seat pinched the back of my legs, and that was bothering me but what he was doing with his fingers sure wasn’t so I unbuttoned all the way to let him do it more, “Oh, God, do it more,” and then suddenly he was in my hand all slippery and nice and just when he was ready to go off and just when I was about cum for I guess the first time ever -- our headlights snap back on. He makes me get out of the truck and go look at something over by a pile of leaves. It was (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 52.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goldie, the neighbor’s labrador. And it still had the panty-hose around its neck from when he hung it from the tree. Gina stares without blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Maybe I didn’t know Rocky.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CYDNEY (CONT’D) Rocky said if I ever told anybody, he’d come get me -- swore he’d track me down. There was no place on Earth he wasn’t gonna find me.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ya ever tell anybody? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something SLAMS into the tarp. Both girls SCREAM. But it was only a tree branch, driven by the wind. They decompre with nervous laughter.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Always amazes me how much people talk about themselves when they’re on vacation...talk to people they only just met.... 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 Just beyond the reach of the lantern, Cliff circles the strangers’ camp, trying to get to the other side, trying locate that missing man.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Spring-loaded, Cliff whirls, grabbing, shoving the man up against a tree trunk, cocking the axe behind one ear. You Cliff? It’s “Chronic.”

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Cliff Anderson? The doper son from the general store.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What’re you doin’ here?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Shoots, thought that was you at that camp. But then I seen four peeps, not two, and that stumbled me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 53.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What’re you doin’? Why are you followin’ us? Who’s the female?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Just my bitch Jessie.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: BUT WHAT’RE YOU DOIN’ HERE?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Your permits! You left your permits at the store! Okay?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: And you came all this way? to.... Just

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Momma thought you’d need them. (off Cliff’s look) Hey, brah, it’s Hawaii. We do that shit here. Cliff realizes he’s still holding the guy like you’d hold suicide bomber with his thumb on the detonator. He releas Chronic pulls out the missing permits.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Guess we’re all stressed with those killers bein’ over here now. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: What, on this island?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Saw some news report about it. didn’t?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: I don’t watch the news. informational. You Way too

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Hey, wanna come back to camp? Have some dinner with us. C’mon, you and your, uh, bitch-friend.

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Thanks -- but I’m not feelin’ the runnin’ stream of love here. Gonna banzai back to town. But watch yourself on this trail, huh? Mess you up good ‘less you know it good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 54. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 20 minutes later. The rain is letting up, but daylight is nearly gone. Soaked to his underwear, Cliff slogs back in camp.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Where you been, babe? okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Where’s Nicko at?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Last time I saw him, it was somewhere over in that.... Nick reappears. Something’s yoked over his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, lookit that. Reaching camp, Nick dumps it on the ground. A big bloody one. Yeah. It’s a goat.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: One to the neck, broke it off, body’s clean.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Baby, you are a Man In Full. But howzabout we put its head thataway, so it drains downhill instead of all over our shit? Gina pulls pink Latex gloves from her pack.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Be sure and cinch off the esophagus this time, huh? Don’t wanna foul the meat.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Now you gonna do this, or am I?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Cliff) Ran into your two friends. They looked a little spooked. What’d you say to them, anyway?  Page 55.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Just, uh....

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Borrow that thing, Cliff? Gloved up, Gina slips the axe out of his hand. She pushes button on the handle -- a button he never saw -- and a kn jumps from the bottom of the handle: These people have weapons inside weapons. GINA (CONT’D) Spent one summer in the meat department at Piggly Wiggly’s, so this ain’t nothin’ to me. But if you’re squeamish.... She rips the goat from sternum to anus. As with everythin Gina does it with a certain tawdry panache.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Cliff, Cydney) Guys hungry?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Would it be too late to get goat cheese out of this?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (grubbing around inside the goat) See first...you gotta pull out the bag...the gut-bag...which is more interesting than gory, really.... 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 Cliff and Cydney crawl into their tent. It’s dark and tig in here -- the perfect setting for a hushed but urgent conversation. Through the flap, we can see Nick and Gina peeling down the goat carcass.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Okay. These two have graduated to the “officially crazy” category. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: So let’s get out of here. Just pack up and go. We’ll come up with an excuse and just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 56. Like what? killers?”

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: “We think you’re the

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: One of us isn’t feeling good. We don’t have to go through with this. C’mon, babe, we’ll leave right -CLIFF It was hard enough comin’ in. you wanna leave? Now

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Well, what do you suggest? He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Only couple more miles to the beach.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Be people there....

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: I think we have to ride this out -keep Nick talkin’, keep he’s gonna be the star of some movie, keep ‘em both happy so that everyone gets to that beach alive. But we keep the game face on. Do not let them know anything’s wrong here. Y’understand me? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subordinating, she rolls away and then spoons back into h Her eyes puddle up.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: And I thought we were gonna have a real honeymoon.... 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 CLOSE on Cliff’s eyes. They crack open after a few misera hours of sleep. What woke him? That THUMPING SOUND? He turns to check on Cydney... And finds her missing. The THUMPING GROWS LOUDER. spiders through the tent-flap... 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and stands up outside. Cliff 46  Page 57. WIDE FROM HELICOPTER: The storm has been chased away by a brilliant blue morning. Already up, Nick, Gina, and Cydne watch TWO POLICE HELOS CIRCLE the campsite aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (at Cliff) Shit, it was only one goat! Abruptly the helos break off... And start vulturing over a second campsite down the coast An AMPLIFIED VOICE booms orders:

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND....
dialogues.text: Cliff starts running there. Nick hooks his arm.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Those boys’re comin’ heavy. Might wanna hang back, let ‘em do their -Cliff shirks free. He Gina follows. Nick stays behind to pour himself more coff 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough hands lift someone’s face out of the mud. It’s Kale already cuffed, getting hair-yanked onto his feet. Cleo g similar handling.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: What’re you messin’ with us for? Nothin’ to do with it. Nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: CLEO
dialogues.text: Get your hands offa.... HE’S FUCKIN’ GROPIN’ ME, THIS GUY! HEEELP! Nearby, a PERIMETER COP blocks the trail. Cliff, Cydney, Gina hustle up, joining a few other trekkers being held b But everyone can see what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: So what the hell they do? Can’t say.

dialogues.speaker: PERIMETER COP
dialogues.text: 47  Page 58.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: Go ahead, look all you want! You think there’s a gun here? Show me a gun! Show me!

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (to perimeter cop) Somethin’ about Honolulu, ain’t it? The murders there?

dialogues.speaker: PERIMETER COP
dialogues.text: Really can’t say.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: (to Cliff) They think it’s them. Kale and Cleo.... Overhearing, Perimeter Cop turns back to give her a look. He’s one of these guys who can make anyone feel like a criminal.

dialogues.speaker: PERIMETER COP
dialogues.text: Friends of yours?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: We just ran into them once or twice.

dialogues.speaker: PERIMETER COP
dialogues.text: Which is it? Once or twice?

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: We barely know them, okay? CLOSE on latexed hands searching belongings. There’s no g in Kale’s rucksack, but the hands dwell on a box of Chicl gum -- a curiously NOISY BOX. When that box is opened... Teeth spill out. Shattered human teeth.

dialogues.speaker: KALE
dialogues.text: That ain’t mine! He put that there! These guys are planting shit in my bag!

dialogues.speaker: PERIMETER COP
dialogues.text: (to Cydney) Well, prob'ly a good thing you don’t know them. Very good thing.  Page 59.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (to Cliff and Cydney) Wow. And I thought it was you guys this whole time. The humor is lost on Cliff -- at first. Then he starts laughing at the irony, laughing in relief, laughing all t way to the ground. Finding it infectious, Cydney goes off too.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Oh, God. So much for our “game face,” huh? 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 The expansive sand flats of Kalalau Beach stretch below u Green cathedral mountains backdrop the beach, and sea mis create a hazy rainbow over the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, whoopty-tah. Back on the trail and back in good spirits, Cliff, Cydney Nick, Gina overlook the magical place that is Kalalau Bea Everyone’s muddy as hell and proud of it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ample time to sunset, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff breaks out the Handycam.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Get the two of us? rainbow here? Cliff and Cydney cozy up. Front of the Gina rolls video.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: We survived The Trail! honeymoon! And our

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: This is it! End of the line! 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 Other people dot the sand, though it’s anything but crowd here. In a series of VIGNETTES, we set the stage:

dialogues.speaker: A49
dialogues.text: Nude RA-DEVOTEES doing an eccentric combination of sun worship, yoga, and kabuki theatre...

dialogues.speaker: A49
dialogues.text: Page 60.

dialogues.speaker: B49
dialogues.text: Cliff, Cydney, Nick, Gina setting up camp close to the inland tree-line...

dialogues.speaker: C49
dialogues.text: Nick slugging mescal, eyeing the scorpion floating inside still pondering that dead-or-alive issue...

dialogues.speaker: D49
dialogues.text: TEENS playing nerf-ball...

dialogues.speaker: E49
dialogues.text: Gina heading for the waterfall with empty water-camels, rolling the Handycam en route...

dialogues.speaker: F49
dialogues.text: Cliff firing up a stove...

dialogues.speaker: G49
dialogues.text: Nick joining the nerf-ball game, playing QB of course...

dialogues.speaker: H49
dialogues.text: Gina at the waterfall now, cleaning the trail axe of drie goat blood...

dialogues.speaker: J49
dialogues.text: FOUR KAYAKERS beaching their boats, heading up the sand t explore...

dialogues.speaker: K49
dialogues.text: And a LONG SHOT of Cliff and Cydney kicking back at the campsite, talking quietly, holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down on the wet sand now, Nick checks out the kayaks. Cliff joins.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Sea caves down the coast.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Read about that. Round this point, west-southwest, I guess. Cliff floats a kayak.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: So let’s do it. (off Nick’s look) I cut a deal with those guys -- two kayaks, one hour, 40 bucks. Torn, Nick checks his watch, then looks back toward the waterfall. Toward the unseen Gina. CLIFF (CONT’D) And no, you don’t owe me 20.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Got some plans here, that’s all. 50  Page 61.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What kinda plans?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Covert plans. Nick.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You can handle a kayak.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, pallie, I shot Fives on the Grand Canyon in one of these things.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: So lessgo. Give us a chance to talk about our movie deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does the trick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: CYDNEY! TELL HER I’LL BE BACK FOR A

dialogues.speaker: SUNSET WALK
dialogues.text: Cydney waves her understanding. 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 Returning with filled water-camels, Gina spots Cliff and rolling kayaks through the breakers.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (to Cydney)

dialogues.speaker: WHERE THOSE BOYS OFF TO
dialogues.text: Down the beach, Cydney can be seen filing her nails at th campsite.

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: Won’t be long now....

dialogues.speaker: CYDNEY
dialogues.text: WON’T BE LONG! Gina nods. She picks off a few shots of the boys as they clear the breakers. Good stuff. But when she tries to shu the Handycam down... She accidentally depresses the memory stick. It ejects. She pushes it back in its slot -- and that activates the auto-load feature: Suddenly all kinds of stored photos are popping up on the LCD screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 62. 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff and Nick in kayaks. 53 52 Turning west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 Gina. Sitting down in warm sand, toggling through photos, going back in time to a wedding in California. It brings wistful smile to Gina’s face. For a second or two.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, now who are these.... Gina straightens as if an ice spear is shoved up her spin Something’s wrong. Impossibly wrong. Suddenly Gina’s on h feet, running. Nick?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: The Handycam hits the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 Cliff and Nick. They spot Gina splashing into the surf, shouting, waving.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What’s she sayin’?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not sure. But got a good bounce to her, doesn’t she? (waving paddle) SUNSET! I’M COMIN’ BACK! 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina. Remembering she has a cell phone, she whips it out, speed dials “Nicko.” All she gets is a FAST BUSY.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You hunka shit! GINA’S POV: Cliff and Nick vanishing around a rocky point. She fast-scans all around her. Low cliffs prevent her fro following via the beach. But inland -- back by the waterf -- there’s a saddle in the mountains. Can she follow that way? 55  Page 63. Axe in hand, Gina runs. on it. SOMEONE ELSE’S POV: She runs like Nick’s life depends

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching Gina vanish inland. It’s Cydney. She reaches down and picks up the Handycam, the one Gina dropped like Kryptonite. She looks at the screen and sees what Gina saw -- and knows what Gina know LOW-ANGLE of the Handycam again dropping onto sand. Beyon we see Cydney’s feet...then her legs...then all of her as sprints away. But we STAY RIGHT HERE on... The Handycam’s LCD screen. It shows Cliff and Cydney posi for wedding photographs -- only it’s not Cliff and Cydney At least not the ones we know. The battery fails. 56 The screen dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 Cliff leads as they paddle west down the coast, mountains their left. Nick slows to take in the magnificent isolati

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (O.S./RADIO)
dialogues.text: Runnin’ out of gas? Cliff is waving a little two-way radio at him. Nick searc his kayak and comes up with a matching unit. Over radios:

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Our own tactical frequency, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Let’s keep the speed up. you back in time. Copy that. Want to get

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Jedi out.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: “Copy that. Jedi out.” 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina claws her way to the top of the waterfall. She splashes across the small but swift river up here. Loses her balance. Goes down. Flails her way to the other side. Finds a foot path... And charges on, pushing west. 57  Page 64. 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 Nick and Cliff paddle toward a jagged opening in the coas It’s a sea cave -- but with sunlight inside. 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 They ride into the cave on an ocean swell.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hoooo-yah.... There’s open sky above them. rock-faced cauldron. It’s like being inside a huge

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: “Hoooo-yah....” 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 Gina reaches a vertical wall of vegetation -- a near-perf dead-end. She scans desperately for a low-point she can negotiate, but it’s just not there.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Where, where, where.... Eyes down, she follows the foot path faithfully to its terminus. It brings her to a different section of wall... And there it is. foliage. She rips it free from years of entangled It’s a long knotted rope. 61 The world’s worst ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 Gina tops the rope and explodes past CAMERA -- the CAMERA THAT NOW PEERS BACK DOWN the wall of vegetation she just climbed. Someone’s down there, following her. Cydney. 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina blitzes to the edge of a sea cliff. spot any kayaks on the coast below her.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE ARE YOU
dialogues.text: 62 Looks down. Can’t  Page 65. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick floats on his kayak as if floating in a backyard poo legs strewn overboard, sipping Mescal, just letting the incoming swells cradle-rock him back and forth. Cliff is perched on a rock outcropping at the center of the cave. 63

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Wanna ask you something, Nick. Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: “Shake that bush.” What’s that from? What is that?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Kiddin’ me.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Special Op lingo?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “What we have here is failure to communicate.” (sitting up to make eye-contact) Paul Newman. “Cool Hand Luke.” Right ‘fore he makes his break from the chain-gang. Man, you should know that.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: I should, huh? Nick as he considers the dead scorpion floating in his bottle. Then he considers himself floating inside this ca Not so different, really.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He goes in alive.... Alarms sound in his head as we RACK FOCUS to the backroun Cliff is gone from the rock outcropping. Nick knows it without even looking.

dialogues.speaker: A63
dialogues.text: ALL IN ONE SHOT: Making no sudden moves, Nick sets his mescal bottle adrift. It fills with water, and we FOLLOW THAT SINKING BOTTLE underwater, leading us to Nick’s hand he reaches for his ankle-blade. We FOLLOW THAT BLADED HAN back up to the surface -- where Cliff has reappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 66.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Well, the stories were great, Nick. Really helpful. He takes a 9mm out of its baggie like a guy unwrapping lu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIFF (CONT’D) But your “situational awareness?” Actually kinda sucks. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 WIDE FROM HELICOPTER: Gina skids to a stop at another edg this one overlooking the open-ceiling cave. She gets ther just in time to witness... 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 Nick’s murder. Cliff....

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Call me “Nick.”

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The pistol sounds like a cannon inside the sea cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 BOOM! Suddenly we’re somewhere else, looking at the start face of the world’s newest murder victim. Boneless, he dr out of FRAME to reveal the gunman who just put a slug in back of the victim’s head. It’s Cliff -- or at least the guy we know as “Cliff.” But now he has stringy locks, chin hair, predatory eyes. With him is... “Cydney.” Only now she’s a dirty blonde with eyebrow-rings. WIDER to show that we’re on a wharf in Honolulu Harbor. R and THUMPING CLUB MUSIC helped dampen the gunshots. There a second body here, too, that of... The real Cydney. She lies next to her husband of three da their blood mingling on the boardwalk. (NOTE: Prior to this moment, we’ve seen the real Cliff an Cydney only in the wedding video that began the movie. An even then, we only glimpsed them.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 67.

dialogues.speaker: A66
dialogues.text: In FAST CLOSEUPS, we see:

dialogues.speaker: A66
dialogues.text: “Cliff’s” hands removing wallets...wedding rings...car keys...Handycam... “Cydney’s” hands SNICKING OPEN A STILETTO, pearl-handled. It cuts a sample of the real Cydney’s hair... “Cliff” producing a Leatherman tool, selecting a file, running it down the barrel of a 9mm to change rifling-mar “Cydney” holding the real Cydney’s hand flat to the groun palm up. And like any good whittler, she cuts away from h “CLIFF” Rule One.... “CYDNEY” Never cut forensics a break. “Cliff” switches to pliers -- and goes after teeth. 67

dialogues.speaker: FIVE NIGHTS AGO
dialogues.text: 67 The surface is stippled by rain. Presently 20 small objec appear, streaming blood as they float down at us. They’re fingerpads. 68 They’re fingerprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 SURVEILLANCE CAM POV: “Cliff” and “Cydney” dragging two bodies into FRAME...stuffing them under a trashy stairwel and withdrawing from this POV. 69

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: 69 The Handycam is patched into a shitty Motorola TV. Weddin video plays. We see Cliff’s brother throwing Cliff in a headlock. Absorbing the details is... “Cliff.” Shaving his facial hair.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (ON VIDEO)
dialogues.text: My little brother gettin’ married before me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (ON VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wonder why. C’mon, let up.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (ON VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Hey, barkeep! ‘Nother brewsky here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 68.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (ON VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Tommy, your armpit smells like ass, okay? Will you let the fuck up? Christ, 28 years old and he’s still doin’ it to me....

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (ON VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Came all the way from Michigan to do this one more time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT WITH “Cydney” nearby. Darkening her hair with a color kit. Referencing both a driver’s license tucked int the mirror frame and the hair sample she took last night. “CYDNEY” Loreal #40. “Espresso Brown.”

dialogues.speaker: A69
dialogues.text: In CU MONTAGE, scissors working...hair hitting the floor.

dialogues.speaker: A69
dialogues.text: piercings being removed...wedding ring being added...thei victims’ clothes being shrugged on, zipped up, buttoned d

dialogues.speaker: B69
dialogues.text: CUs OF JUST THEIR MOUTHS:

dialogues.speaker: B69
dialogues.text: “CLIFF” “Well, we say ‘screenwriter,’ not ‘screenplay writer’...” “CYDNEY” “Don’t know why I’m tellin’ you this. We just came here to dance... “CLIFF” “...just a two-week punch-up....” “CYDNEY” ...always amazes me how much people talk about themselves when they’re on vacation...talk to people they only just met....” 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 Suitcase WHEELS CLACK-CLACK over a boardwalk. Pulling the suitcase, “Cydney” catches her reflection in storefront window. It brings her to a stop. “Cliff” appea in the distorted reflection beside her. Their transformat is dramatic and persuasive. “CYDNEY” She was kind of classy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 69. “CLIFF” (chastising) Rule Two. Keep your game face on. 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 HORNS BLAST. A ramp retracts. Diesel fumes cloud the air. The FERRY GROANS away from the pier with... “Cliff” and “Cydney” aboard. “Cliff” ejects the DV tape t shows the real Cliff and Cydney, drops it into the harbor As he clacks in a fresh tape, he notes... A taxi speeding onto the pier. Two people pile out, SHOUTING for the ferry to wait. “Cliff” just stares as the ferry gains speeds, no compassion for the two missed the boat. Compassion is for others. For the For idiots. waving, emptily who weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CLIFF” (offering Handycam) Hey, you mind getting us here? An OBLIGING STRANGER rolls tape as “Cliff” and “Cydney” c up against the ferry railing. They’re falling right into character. 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the two people left standing on the pier? Nick and Gi From here, they can still see “Cliff” and “Cydney” at the rear of the departing ferry.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, shit. Maybe that wasn’t the one to Kauai.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Pretty sure it was, doll baby.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No, no, think that was the one to Maui -- smaller boat. We’re lookin’ for the somethin’ with some big-ass hydrofoils and.... She taps his shoulder, points to a embarkation sign. “Kauai.”

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Pretty sure it was. 72  Page 70.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Y’know, if you’re so smart, you’d play dumb once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Let’s find us a schedule. much time we gotta kill. 73 See how

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 Just inside the store, Gina tries on gimcrack jewelry. Ni peruses a display of adventure brochures. Soon Gina moves deeper into the store and starts to eye pricier stuff lik Diamond rings.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Something I can show you?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, not me. But see that dangerously handsome man just over there? When he asks what I was in here lookin’ at, you can show him this ring...and that one...and by all means, this liddle rascal right here.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (re Nick) Seems more interested in water sports, right now.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: That’s just an operational cover -trust me, he’s watchin’ second now, he’s gonna come in here, pull me out -- but leave something behind so that he can double-back and ask you, private-like, what I was lookin’ at.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Been playing this game awhile?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (sighing) “Nicko” -- love him to tears, but he does take his own sweet time. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting the store: 74  Page 71. Shoot. What?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Left my canteen.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I’ll wait right here. 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing rings to Nick:

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: ...oh, and let’s not overlook this little “rascal” right here. So I take it you’re planning the next step?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Oh, I got plans. Nick unpockets a ring-box. Oh. 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covert plans. Inside is another diamond ring.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Gonna make a sunset proposal on Kalalau Beach -- supposed to be one of the most romantic spots there is, right? But I just wanna be sure this isn’t, you know, “underwhelming” compared to whatever’s stuck in that twangy little head of hers. The clerk takes the ring. Puts a loup on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK (CONT’D) That’s what they called a real “heirloom” diamond. Beat out 19 other bidders for it. (biting a lip) Will it fly?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Well, to tell the truth....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks it’s shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 72.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Look, if it’s truly gonna disappoint her, I’ll roll over and play dead for you -- I’ll be the easiest mark you ever had. But please, just help me get it right. Never had to do this whole diamond thing before -- and I don’t ever wanna do it again. Gina’s gonna be the first and the last for me. She is the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there’s one thing that comes through with Nick -- thro all his bravado and foibles -- is that he’s got heart. A elephant’s heart.

dialogues.text: To tell the truth...I think she’ll love anything you give her. She hands his ring back. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 Flipping his water bottle conspicuously, Nick exits.

dialogues.text: Didn’t work, did it?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: On me? Nooohoho -- they ran into one tough hombre.

dialogues.text: So you didn’t buy anything?

dialogues.text: What would I want in there?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, you took so long, I just....

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nooohoho. Got away clean. 1300, catch that ferry? Almost He slaps her ass to get her moving then struggles to unca his bottle. Gina cracks it for him.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sweaty hands.

dialogues.text: That happens around me.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And always in public, for some fuckin’ reason. They share a laugh, and we can see how these two were mad for each other. But reaching a corner, their faces fall: Patrol cars flashing. hustling to go live. DETECTIVES mulling. Anxious REPORTERS A van WHOOP-WHOOPS behind Nick and Gina. They clear for t “COUNTY CORONER” van as it joins the crime scene ahead.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: C’mon. Don’t got nothin’ to do with us. 77

dialogues.text: On a 50-inch widescreen, we watch a forensics show on the Discovery Channel, “The New Detectives.” PULL BACK to rev a grand hotel suite. A WAITER lays out breakfast, pouring two flutes of Perrier-Jouet, dropping a raspberry into ea

dialogues.text: (calling) Complementary, Mr. Anderson. of the honeymoon package. Part “Cliff” steps out of a marble-clad bathroom, toweling off “CLIFF” You’re the best. Take the old cart with you? Oh, and take this too. He tips twenty. The waiter jangles out happy. “Cliff” drinks champagne straight from the bottle as he turns up volume on the widescreen.

dialogues.speaker: TV NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...it was only then that the detectives realized the reason they had found no fingerprints at the crime scene was because the robbers had coated their fingers with adhesive -- or “Super Glue” -- prior to entering the bank.... 77  Page 74. “CLIFF” Fuckin’ repeat. He clicks off. Dumps the remote. Sifts through some of th real Cliff’s belongings, finding... Permits for the Kalalau Trail. They’re paper-clipped to a color brochure of the trail. “The Perfect Getaway.” 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 The suite’s balcony has explosive views of the Pacific an the island Nihili. “Cydney” lounges face-down topless on chaise, luxuriating in the soft trade winds. “Cliff” steps outside with the Handycam. Hai view. He shoots the Bali “CYDNEY” Tell me it’ll never end. “CLIFF” Always ends. Trick is... HANDYCAM POV: ZOOMING IN on another couple on another balcony. She’s sprawled across his lap, slathering him wi kisses. Newlyweds. About the right age, too. “CLIFF” ...to have more starts than ends. To have the idiot cops always playin’ catch-up. HANDYCAM POV: The woman moves inside. We get a better ang on the man now: He’s black. The woman was white. Losing interest, “Cliff” shuts down the Handycam. “CYDNEY” Well, all I wanna do is catch up on my sleep right now.... “CLIFF” Rule Three.... “CYDNEY” Oh, go away with your rules. Nothin’s gettin’ me off this balcony today. He dumps cold champagne on her back. off the chaise. She squeals and jumps

dialogues.text: Page 75. “CYDNEY” You unbelievable asshole! “CLIFF” Never wear the same skin too long. We keep moving.

dialogues.text: While we’re still young, Cliff! “Cliff” stands to get a sight-line: Nick, Gina, and “Cydn are all loaded up and ready to head back down. One sec! “CLIFF”

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Thanks -- but I’m not feelin’ the runnin’ stream of love here. Gonna banzai back to town. But watch yourself on this trail, huh? Mess you up good ‘less you know it good.

dialogues.speaker: THE REST OF THE SCENE
dialogues.text: Chronic starts to leave. Cliff catches him. “CLIFF” Hang on. I was waitin’ to tell a ranger, but haven’t seen any yet. And I don’t know that it’s really anything...I mean, maybe people are allowed to carry guns out here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 76. Guns?

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Nahhh. Who’s got guns? “CLIFF” Goes by “Kale.” Runs with a girl, “Cleo.” If those are their real names.

dialogues.speaker: CHRONIC
dialogues.text: Big caveman dude? Little hoser chick?

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Might’ve been a 9mm -- not too good at these things. But maybe when you get back, you tell somebody ‘bout this, okay? Maybe you let the cops decide if it’s important or not.... 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 REDUX: We’re back in the Jeep stopped at roadside. shows a grocery-store wedding photo to “Cliff.” “Cydney” “CYDNEY” Kale and Cleo getting married on Oahu. “CLIFF” (nodding “nice”) Suitable for framing.

dialogues.speaker: A33
dialogues.text: REDUX: We’re back at the spillway with Nick and Gina. 30 yards back, “Cliff” and “Cydney,” take a piss break.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Interesting guy, Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: First man ever who wants to talk while he’s in the bathroom, though. What is goin’ on back there?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: BB33 "Cliff" and "Cydney." Now we get the PART OF THE SCE weren’t privy to before:

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: I say let Nick keep pitching his stories. Let him dig his own grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 77.

dialogues.speaker: "CYDNEY"
dialogues.text: (resisting) This isn’t Honolulu -- and this guy isn’t some soft-boy screenplay writer.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: What, you actually buy this Jedi shit? He gets his skull opened up by a land-mine and walks it off? He’s tryin’ to impress me. Me. Because he thinks I’m gonna make a movie out of his life, everything becomes exaggerated, overblown. Trust me, I know a narcissist when I see one -and this guy is amateur (correcting her) “Screenwriter.”

dialogues.speaker: "CYDNEY"
dialogues.text: I don’t know...if half his stories are true.... “CLIFF” I know exactly what he is, and he has no clue what I am. That’s the advantage we exploit. (almost a throwaway) Let’s do it at the beach. “CYDNEY” Be people there.... “CLIFF” So we split the herd and run ‘em down, just like it’s been done for millions of years. “CYDNEY” Just feels like we’re rushing.... “CLIFF” Don’t tell me you’re startin’ to like Gina. See, that’s your mistake, you get too close, you get too attached to your -“CYDNEY” Maybe I’m starting to like Cydney. “CLIFF” Bigger mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 78. “CYDNEY” She’s a nice girl. And I want you to start thinking of me like Cliff would think of her. Even if it’s not real. Even if you’re physically incapable of actually being like that, I want you to pretend that part of it, too. It’s a perverse resistance but understandable: Cydney is everything that “Cydney” never had a chance to be. Rain starts falling. From the other side of the spillway...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “YOU KEEP SHAKIN’ THAT BUSH SO WE KNOW YOU’RE THERE! JUST KEEP SHAKIN’ THAT BUSH, LUKE!” “Cliff” smiles and waves.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: What is this idiot talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: B33
dialogues.text: Now PATCH BACK INTO the part we did see: “Cydney” decides she’s not going to let her head go where “Cliff’s” went.

dialogues.speaker: B33
dialogues.text: “CYDNEY” Look, we’re supposed to be on our honeymoon, okay? And this is one of the most beautiful places on Earth -rain or shine -- so w just slow down that overactive brain of yours. I want to enjoy myself here. She starts across the spillway toward Nick and Gina. lingers, fixated on that photo on his cell phone. “Cliff” “CYDNEY” Babe, we’re gonna be fine. 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REDUX: We’re back in the storm. Back under the lean-to wi "Cydney" and Gina as something SLAMS into the tarp. Both girls SCREAM. But it was only a tree branch, driven by th wind. They decompress with nervous laughter. “CYDNEY” Always amazes me how much people talk about themselves when they’re on (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41  Page 79. “CYDNEY” (CONT'D) vacation...talk to people they only just met....

dialogues.text: “Cydney” digs in her pack, produces little “wontons” of aluminum foil. She peels one open to reveal clear chunky crystals.

dialogues.speaker: "CYDNEY"
dialogues.text: Like I said, “Dope was never my thing.” Wanna go fast?

dialogues.text: Thanks. But that shit’s a little West Coast for me.

dialogues.speaker: "CYDNEY"
dialogues.text: Well, I can handle it, but Cliff... gotta keep it away from him because he just goes all.... Well, you do not want to get him goin’ fast.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Cliff? Our Cliff? I took him for Mr. Dolphin Safe Tuna.

dialogues.speaker: "CYDNEY"
dialogues.text: He’s more complicated than that. 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 CLOSE as hands open a foil wonton...drop crystal chunks i a glass pipe...heat the pipe over the stove until the crystals liquefy and start to sublime. “Cliff” and “Cydney” relax at the beach campsite. takes a deep pull on the pipe as he clocks... “Cliff”

dialogues.speaker: A79
dialogues.text: Gina. Heading toward the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: B79
dialogues.text: Nick. Playing nerf-ball.

dialogues.speaker: C79
dialogues.text: The four kayakers. QB of course. Beaching their kayaks.

dialogues.speaker: C79
dialogues.text: Page 80. “Cliff” exhales -- and his lids lower dangerously, his fa reminding us of a young lion overlooking the Serengeti pl Of an apex predator. “CLIFF” Sometimes I wonder if they were all created for us. If they had any life before we showed up. Sometimes it seems like nothing exists until we get there...till we put eyes on it. Like the whole fucking world was manufactured just for our wants and needs. “CYDNEY” Think it’ll be a nice sunset? “CLIFF” I mean, if I look away...turn my head for a second here...would they all stop moving? Shut down? Just go into some energy-saving hibernation mode until the time I choose to reactivate them by simply....

dialogues.speaker: D79
dialogues.text: He looks back. The people on the beach are moving again. Just like he expected. (VFX SHOT.) “CYDNEY” You should say sweet stuff to me once in a while. “CLIFF” (test-driving a new rule) It’s like...like reality doesn’t exist until we get there.... “CYDNEY” C’mon, babe. Drop the l-word on me. She rubs his crotch. Immune, he offers her the pipe. “CLIFF” I’ll take Nick. You’re on Gina. “CYDNEY” Hey, fuck you dead, huh? “CLIFF” How many times do I need to say it? If there’s one person in the world I could love, it’s you. Why is that never enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 81. “CYDNEY” Forget it, forget it, forget it.... She looks off. He reaches out and takes her hand. “CLIFF” It’s you who helps create this -this fever-dream of immor You’re the privileged witness who’s going to help me lead a hundred different lives. It’s you. She dumps his hand. “CYDNEY” How’s this for a new rule? “Always be sincere even when you’re not.” (off his wounded look) Look, I understand that in some bent way, my need for attachment fits your need for detachment, okay? It’s a fucking fit and a fitting fuck. That’s it. So let’s not lie to ourselves anymore. “CLIFF” I’m not lying now. of loving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the idea Two “loves” in the same breath: It doesn’t even add up to one, really, not in the real world. But it’s more than “Cydney” typically gets. “CYDNEY” And I love hearing it. It’s sick, it’s sad, but I do. Does that make me crazy, Rocky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CLIFF” It makes you exciting. She accepts the pipe. Accepts the blood-letting to come. “CYDNEY” (as Gina) “Well, whoopty-tah.” Now “Cliff” lines up Nick with his pistol-fingers.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The pistol sounds like a cannon inside the sea cave. 80  Page 82. A bullet tags Nick behind the ear. Blood sprays as he fal back onto the kayak, overturning it. Nick slides into the water like a dead seal.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOOO....
dialogues.text: "Cliff" snaps a look up to see... Gina 50 feet above him, perched on the rim of the sea cav her face stretched in anguish. "Cliff" lifts his 9mm, FIRES. 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS CHEW the rocky lip at Gina’s feet. but now spots... 81 She spirals away “Cydney.” Charging with the stiletto. Maybe she said she could handle crystal meth, but right now she looks W.O.A. Collision. 82 Gina’s trail-axe goes airborne...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and falls here, whiskering past Cliff before BITING in the hull of the Nick’s kayak. 83

dialogues.text: WIDE FROM HELICOPTER: FIGHT SCENE. Veteran of a few bar brawls, Gina drives a knee into “Cydney’s” crotch. It’s half-effective against a woman -- so Gina does it again f full effect. When "Cydney" goes lax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina torques free, stripping the stiletto from “Cydney’s” hand as she gains her feet. Mistake #1: She’s letting up the middle of a fight.

Still on her knees, "Cydney" blocks with one arm, uppercuts with the other, catching Gina...  Page 83. Square in the solar-plexus. An inhuman sound gushes out - The stiletto goes free. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 "Cliff" trains his pistol on the overturned kayak -- wait for Nick to resurface. And waiting. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 "Cydney" snatches up the stiletto, cocks it overhead as s speeds back, trying to finish the fight with one big “Psy stab on... Gina. Rising as if to meet the attack... Then dropping low, chopping "Cydney" at the knees. Still coming down, the stiletto digs into Gina’s ass. Gina GASPS PAIN even as she drives up and out, giving it she’s got. "Cydney" somersaults overhead... ...slams flat-backed near the rim of the sea cave... ...tumbles through open air... 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 ...and makes a LIQUID CRATER in the water below. 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina yanks the blade out of her ass. She’s desperate to g back to the edge to look again -- to check for Nick -- bu knows "Cliff" is down there gunning for her.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Nicko? (nothing)

dialogues.speaker: NICKOOOO
dialogues.text: Still nothing. With an inspiration, Gina grubs through he ditty bag for... Her phone. Her camera phone. Staying low, she shimmies to the edge...rolls on her back holds the phone overhead. CH-CLICK! If you had to photograph Medusa, this would be how. 87  Page 84. CLOSE on her phone. A photo of the sea cave resolves. Just one overturned kayak. Nothing else. “What the hell?” It resolves. Gina steals another photo. Still nobody. A hold-your-breath beat -- then Gina rolls over and puts naked eyes on... The sea cave below. "Cliff" and “Cydney” are both gone. All Gina sees now is the overturned kayak -- and a floati Boonie hat nearby.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: 88 Of Gina all alone. Eerily so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 Gina hobbles to a cliff on the sea side. She can HEAR SUR CRASHING below, but the shore itself is blocked from view She scans the ocean. Are they paddling back to the beach? Where the hell are they? Her suspicion returns to... The cliff below her. CLOSE on Gina’s feet. Inching closer to the edge. GINA’S POV: Easing out over the sea-cliff. Trying to see more. Needing to know if they’re climbing up to get her. And just as every nerve-ending in her body is focused on danger below... Her PHONE GOES OFF. It scares the wet crap out of us. Gin thumbs “TALK” -- and doesn’t. We HEAR BREATHING on the ot end. Is it him? Is “Cliff” calling her now?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (a dread whisper) Who is this? MAN’S VOICE (O.S.) Uh, hello, my name is Woody, and I’m following up today to make sure you’re getting the most out of your current AT&T calling plan. We noticed that you exceeded your “Anytime Minutes” last month -GINA Flamin’ Jesus, you don’t work the whole trip, and now you decide to... What state you in? Where you at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 85. MAN’S VOICE (O.S.) I’m, uh...not supposed to say.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Woody. There’s been some murders in Honolulu, maybe you’ve heard, maybe you haven’t. But they’re comin’ after me, so you gotta help me out here, okay? Woody? You there? We can almost hear Woody’s brain hitting the frying pan o the other end of the call: This wasn’t covered in trainin A DEEP BREATH and then... MAN’S VOICE (O.S.) With our “Free to Roam” plan, we can offer you more minutes regardless of the time of day or even the state you’re -GINA SCREW THE CALLING PLAN and listen to me good. You’re gonna be my 9-1-1 boy, okay, Woody? I need you to call up the police in Princeville, Kauai. You tell them I’m being chased by the killers, and that if they can get to Kalalau Beach in 30 minutes, I’ll have them there. Can you do that for me? WOODY? Another beat. MAN’S VOICE (O.S.) I have to put you on hold now.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: No, you do not check with your supervisor, don’t you dare check, you just do it. And we need some kinda air-ambulance, too, in case.... On the ocean below, "Cydney" appears. She’s paddling a ka backwards, away from shore, stopping when she sees Gina. She’s too far away to be a threat. So what is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (into phone) Can you swear to me you’ll do this? Please, please, swear to me you will. MAN’S VOICE (O.S.) This is in the Pacific Ocean?  Page 86.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Oh, tell me you’re taping this call. Yes it’s in the Pacific Ocean, yes I’m on Kauai, yes it’s one of the five islands of the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CYDNEY’S” VOICE (O.S.) ...to your left...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (into phone) ...the Hawaiian chain of.... “CYDNEY’S” VOICE (O.S.) ...more...more... It’s the world’s strangest ventriloquist act: “Cydney’s” whispered voice is heard nearby, yet "Cydney" herself is quarter-mile off, bobbing on the ocean. With a radio to her mouth. “CYDNEY’S” VOICE (O.S.) Right there. Realizing, Gina spasms to get away from the edge but... Something grabs her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: A88
dialogues.text: And yanks. GO WIDE to reveal "Cliff" in a recess just below her. Wit "Cydney" spotting for him, he made a blind-grab for Gina. Now he’s trying to drag her off the edge. (VFX SHOT.) Gina kicks for all she’s worth. “Cliff’s” other hand appears -- with a BLASTING 9MM. Nightmare of nightmares: Some sociopath who you can’t see ROUNDS at your face from five feet away. The PHONE EXPLODES in Gina’s hand. A chunk of her palm fl away with it. HOWLING pain, Gina keeps kicking until suddenly... She’s free. "Cliff" makes one more blind-grab. And misses. Gina eyes the hand that now gropes for purchase. With a r of unfiltered hatred, she pounces back with the stiletto. And just drills that hand. somewhere below. It brings a BIGGER HOWL from

dialogues.speaker: A88
dialogues.text: Page 87. Leaving him staked to the ground, Gina stumbles back to.. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 The sea cave. Hoping against hope, she scans one more tim for Nick. But he’s gone. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 CLOSE on “Cliff’s” good hand yanking the stiletto out of staked hand. It’s a macabre sight. 91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 In the kayak, “Cydney” watches "Cliff" drag himself up on the cliff-top and look around. There’s no sign of Gina. 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 “CLIFF” (into radio) She got off a call, asked for help back at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick’s kayak rides the swells forlornly. DROPS UNDERWATER to find... 93 Presently CAMERA Nick’s body floating beneath the kayak. We aren’t sure -b 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: runs for her life. 96 On a mountain ridge, one small figure

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina. Hobbled but denying the pain. Moving as fast as she can over uneven, ankle-twisting ground. Somewhere behind comes... "Cliff". Pistol out. Smelling blood. Crunked up on speed and making good time for it. And somewhere behind him... Nick. Gilligan in one hand, axe in the other. Tracking their blood and heedless of his own. Wearing his wounds l a badge of honor, in fact, because he is a Goddamn Americ Jedi. And somewhere far to his left... 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Cydney.” Paddling hard. best time of all. 98 Shooting over swells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 Making the

dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Sorry to scare you. But you wouldn’t happen to have seen two -GINA (crazed) Go back, go back, go back to the beach...he’s comin’ this way....

dialogues.text: Well, we would -- but someone stole two kayaks and some of our gear, okay? Someone who headed off this direc -GINA He’s got a gun...he fuckin’ shot Nicko and he shot me right in the fuckin’ hand, okay? HE’S GOT A GUN! The kayakers swap looks. “What the hell did we walk into?”

dialogues.text: (taking her arm) Let me see that....

dialogues.text: Lemme go, lemme go, lemme -KAYAKER #2 Hey, HEY, HEY. I’m an EMT, okay? I can help, but I just gotta take a look at it first. (to others) Let’s get her down.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: I CAN’T STOP! She fights. The kayakers corral Gina, trying to help but actually putting her in greater danger. Because behind them...unseen... That knotted rope is moving. weight from above. Swaying. Carrying someone’s  Page 90. 99
