dialogues.speaker: KAYAKER
dialogues.text: Gettin’ shocky. Lie her down.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: No, no, no, there’ll be someone at the beach, I called for help, I did, we should all just get back to the -KAYAKER #2 YOU’RE SAFE HERE, OKAY? We’re not gonna let anything happen to you. You’ll be safe as long as you do what I ask you to -GINA He was right behind me a minute ago.... Who was?

dialogues.speaker: KAYAKER
dialogues.text: Who we talkin’ about? Thank God. “CLIFF” (O.S.) Everyone turns to see “Cliff” releasing the rope ladder a strolling forward. His wounded hand is wrapped, but he lo little worse than other trekkers we’ve seen.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Gina, you feelin’ better?

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Ohfuck, ohfuck, ohfuck.... Guess not.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Kayakers #1 and #2 rise to meet "Cliff," faces wary, eyes hunting for any sign of a weapon. The other two hang onto Gina. I’m Cliff. Robert.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Sorry about all this. It’s been a helluva vacation, believe me. And here we all thought it was going to be the trip of a life -KAYAKER #1 Just tell us what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: HE KILLED MY NICKO
dialogues.text: "Cliff" ushers the two kayakers back toward the rope ladd He wants to get out of Gina’s earshot. And vice versa.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Her name is Gina. She’s a friend of my wife’s, and she has a little issue with, uh, well, crystal meth, okay? She’s normally pretty functional, but as you can see, this ain’t normal.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Iced out of her mind right now. Here, lookit this. Proving his point, he picks up a foil wonton. where Gina fell off the rope ladder. It “fell”

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Been finding these whole trip. Kayaker #2, the EMT guy, peels back the foil. Crystals.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Look, she just got in over her head this time. Hope we don’t have to involve police or anyone like that. I’ll make sure she gets back safe. Kayaker #1 and #2 swap glances. “Sounds okay.”

dialogues.speaker: KAYAKER
dialogues.text: Look, we’re just out here ‘cuz someone took off with two of our boats. Last thing we want is to step in someone else’s mess. Right?

dialogues.speaker: KAYAKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Except....  Page 92.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: ‘Cept what?

dialogues.speaker: KAYAKER
dialogues.text: I don’t get why her pupils are normal and yours are the size of olives. A time-stopped moment: until... No heartbeats. No breaths. No words

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: (narcissistically wounded) You know, guys, it was a perfectly good story. Cobra-fast, he comes up with the 9mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina tears free. A100 In RAPID-FIRE SHOTS, "Cliff" drops the kayakers with calm of a guy whacking weeds. (VFX SHOTS.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s fucking shocking how he mows them down just to get a line-of-sight on... Gina. Running like a scalded cat. “Cliff.” He’s got the perfect shot on her backside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 9MM. CLICKING DRY.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Oh, count your freakin’ shots. He ZINGS out a clip. B100 HIGH ANGLE: From a vantage halfway up the rope ladde look down on "Cliff" as he reloads. In SILENT SLOW MOTION Nick freefalls into FRAME after separating from the rope somewhere above, blood in his eyes, cocking back his tactical knife as he drops full-weight toward... "Cliff."

dialogues.speaker: B100
dialogues.text: Slapping home a fresh clip in SLOW MOTION. TIGHT on a metal-tipped strap on Nick’s clothing. Flappin in SLOW MOTION, it goes TING-TING-TING. And just that smallest of sounds... C100 Alerts "Cliff." moment... He upturns his face. “CLIFF” (stunned) Why aren’t you dead? In a time-stopped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 93. D100 A FAST CRASHING COLLISION. The 9MM EXPLODES. The bla flashes and bites. Bodies avalanche across the ground. 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Cydney” beaches the kayak. coast to spot...

dialogues.speaker: D100
dialogues.text: 101 Hears THUMPING. Looks up the A helo coming out of the sun. “Cydney” scans the beach and waterfall area, looking for Gina. She hasn’t make it back yet. The police helo comes in for a beach landing. arms frantically, “Cydney” runs to it. 102 Waving her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 Running, Gina dares to glance over her shoulder -- and fi no one chasing her. Lungs on fire, she slows and listens. It’s eerily quiet back there. 103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 Still down, Nick wears a fresh bullet-wound in one should Not far away... Lies “Cliff.” His good hand is now his bad hand: Nick’s blade came down the valley of his fingers, separating the third and fourth metacarpal and nearly bifurcating the ha Nick reaches for Gilligan. “Cliff” reaches for the 9mm. maimed hands. 104 He struggles to hold it in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 Gina backpedals up the next rise, stretching her neck, tr to gain some elevation to peer back on... The rope-ladder area. feet. A familiar figure staggers to his

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (almost crying) Nicko? 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick advances on “Cliff,” who tries to pull the trigger b finds it’s like shooting with his feet. The FIRST SHOT... 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 94. ZINGS past Nick’s ear. He keeps coming. The SECOND SHOT... Goes wild. Nick keeps coming. A THIRD SHOT... Rips open Nick’s pantleg. With a closing rush of speed, N punts the pistol out of “Cliff’s” hands... ...catches it in midair... ...and sticks the muzzle in “Cliff’s” eye-socket as he ja the tactical knife up under “Cliff’s” chin. He just might kill this fucker twice.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So how many times? you done this to? How many people

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: ‘Nough to get good at it. Christ, bit my tongue. Hate that.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s gonna stop hurting any second now.

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: Oh, you think this is it, Nick? Bad guy buys it, crowd goes nuts? You know what I hate ‘bout that ending? Aside from it being cliche? It’s your version of reality, “pallie”...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Nick, a HELICOPTER ROARS into view, dominating FRA Police are visible through an open door, one with rifle. Not mine. 106

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CLIFF” (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE POV: The four kayakers lie dead on the ground. A fifth victim -- “Cliff” -- is about to be killed by Nic It’s a damning picture, made even more so by... “CYDNEY” (re Nick) Oh, my Go.... That’s him. That’s the one who tried to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 95. Inside, we find “Cydney” with a blanket over her shoulder playing the role of harrowed survivor. A young POLICE LIEUTENANT splits his attention between her...the dire situation below...and the MARKSMAN who awaits his order. 107

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS DOWN, PUT YOUR WEAPONS DOWN
dialogues.text: PROP-WASH BLASTS everything. Nick is momentarily confused Capitalizing on it, “Cliff” grabs Nick’s gun-hand -- and makes sure the barrel of the 9mm stays pointed at him. “CLIFF” What’re you gonna do, Nick? Sure feel good to squeeze that trigger -but you kill me, you k Just ain’t gonna do that, are you? Too much to live for. Too many attachments. Too soft. 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CYDNEY” I’m the one who called for help, they’re the ones who did all those awful things, now please, please do something BEFORE HE KILLS MY HUSBAND! 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CLIFF” What’re we gonna do here, Nick? Don’t kill me and I’ll just come back. These idiots can’t keep me locked up. Hey, one year from today, I want you in Honolulu, Pier 19. Right around noon, some guy will brush by you, give you a little bump. You’ll turn around and see him walking off. He won’t look like me -but might look a litt He’ll be holding a shaved ice, let’s say cherry, bright red in honor of all the blood we spilled here today. Circle the date, Nicko. Because that’s the day you’ll know just how good I really fucking am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 96. 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “CYDNEY”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 “CLIFF” Hoooo-yah.... 112

dialogues.text: (to marksman) Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARKSMAN POV: A nano-second before he takes the shot, another figure careens into his cross-hairs, crashing int Nick, covering him up, acting as a human shield. It’s Gina. A hand grips the marksman’s shoulder. 113 “Hold off!”

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Don’t you die on me, oh Christ, don’t you die again.... Coming out of his homicidal fugue, Nick drops the blade a pistol -- and raises his arms as best he can. 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Cydney.” Sinking back. prevailed this time. 115 Knowing that another reality

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina continues to hug Nick like it was the last day on Ea It nearly was. Behind Nick’s back: Hey. 114

dialogues.speaker: "CLIFF"
dialogues.text: I woulda done it if I were you. Nick crushes his face with a crescent-kick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, you ain’t me. 115  Page 97. A115 The HELO BARKS MORE ORDERS...the PROP-WASH hurricane them...but Nick and Gina are in their own world now, prop each other up, knowing it’ll come out right as long as th both live to tell the tale.

dialogues.text: civilization. 117 Heading up the coast. 116 Heading back to

dialogues.text: 117 In one litter lies Gina, eyes closed, an I.V. line in her hand. Across the aisle is Nick, similarly tended to. As t helo banks, the ocean horizon appears in a window, and Ni hoists himself up to see... God’s best sunset. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: ‘Is’s for you. He’s got the ring-box. Gina takes it but can’t get it ope The MED-TECH helps out.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Holy crap. You buy this on Honolulu? In that shop? E-bay.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Beat out 19 other shmucks.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Well, how long you had it?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Year and a half.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: “A year and a....” What the hell you waitin’ for, you dumb bastard?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: The right moment. She thinks about ragging on him some more -- in fact, she thinks about standing right up and boxing his ears. But h eyes go dewy first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 98.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: (to med-tech) Would you...can you just.... Gently, without disturbing the I.V., the stranger slips t ring on Gina’s finger. Oh, Nicko.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You are a Man in Full. Taking it for a “yes,” Nick leans back. Gina does likewis Suddenly stricken by the same thought...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Let’s not do a honeymoon.
